availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joshua Barnes (Bath Co., KY, State Rep. & doctor)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, physician and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Lucretia Hord Barnes in Mason County, Kentucky, in May 1833. Father of Joseph Barnes, Isabella Barnes, Adelaide E. Barnes, William Robert Barnes, Lucretia Barnes, Joshua Barnes, and Mary Barnes. Married to Adelaide Hord Barnes. Physician in Bath County in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in 1850. Physician in Bath County in 1860. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1862 to 1865. Briefly abducted by the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) in Bath County in March 1863.
